summary:
Apollo 17 was NASA's final Apollo mission, with Gene Cernan, Harrison Schmitt, and Ronald Evans as the crew. They aimed to collect old lunar rock samples and study possible recent volcanic activity. The team landed at Taurus-Littrow, finding volcanic "orange soil." Schmitt, a geologist, was the first scientist to walk on the moon.

This mission set records: longest lunar mission (12 days), farthest distance during a spacewalk (4.7 miles), and most lunar samples returned (254 lbs). It was a significant scientific achievement, marking the last human journey beyond low Earth orbit.
title: Apollo 17
